title: Haggahot Ya'avetz on Avot D'Rabbi Natan

titles.text: הגהות מהריעב״ץ על אבות דרבי נתן
Haggahot Ya'avetz on Avot D'Rabbi Natan

schema.key: Haggahot Ya'avetz on Avot D'Rabbi Natan

enDesc: In addition to the many works he authored more formally, 18th-century German scholar Rabbi Yaakov Emden filled the margins of his copy of the Talmud with notes. He indicated in several places that he intended to publish these notes, but did not do so in his lifetime. They were first printed as Haggahot Ya’avetz (Notes of Yaakov ben Tzvi) in the late-19th-century Vilna edition of the Talmud that is still in wide use today.
enShortDesc: 18th-century notes on the Talmud by Rabbi Yaakov Emden, a well-known German scholar.
